title.narrative: Where is the good samaritan today? HIV project

description.narrative: Good Samaritan Program (GSP) is a pan-African program by the United Bible Societies. It is implemented in over 20 countries in Africa and coordinated by HIV Service. Bible Society of Burundi (BSB) has the main responsibility of the grass root level impleme ntation. The overall objective of the project is to contribute to the reduction of the spread of HIV and stigma of people infected and affected. Through training activities GSP aims to behavioral change that reduces HIV contamination as well as stigmatizat ion and discrimination of people living with HIV and AIDS.GSP promotes tolerance love and human rights. Interactive approach shares information about HIV+AIDS. By utilizing texts from the Bible (e.g. Good Samaritan story) and other material GSP reveals the attitudes and beliefs that maintain discrimination. GSP supports the goals Government of Burundi's (GOB) concerning maternal newborn health and HIV and AIDS. Project encourages people to get tested: the cooperation/network between BSB and the VCTs is in a core of the project. This is how GSP is in line with the GOB health goals (National Health Development Plan 2011-15) which aims to provide all Burundian citizens increased access to basic health care. During the 3rd phase cooperation with organizations pr oviding ARVs food and other services to PLHA will also be widened. Through communication advocacy and disseminating adequate health information GSP has means to change opinions and contribute to the common goals defined by UNAIDS. Project activities are ba sed on interactive training on different levels. Training material include booklets videos and flipchart for trainees and manual for trainers. Take Charge youth component has its own material package. The project will continue with the existing structure a nd target on churches congregations and communities. The 3rd phase is emphasizing the inclusive approach: goal is to ensure the participation of People with Visual Disabilities (PVDs) on all activity levels from the planning till the implementation. These choices are in line with the Finnish Government to strengthen marginalized groups? participation in the development projects. During the 2nd phase of GSP implementation Finnish Bible Society (FiBS) and BSB have systematically continued building their capac ity on disabilities. Regular cooperation with FIDIDA supports and ensures professionalism in the inclusive approach.
